doc.after: Personal transportation is dominated by automobiles, which operate on a network of 4 million miles of public roads,[495] including one of the world's longest highway systems.[496] The world's second largest automobile market,[497] the United States has the highest rate of per-capita vehicle ownership in the world, with 765 vehicles per 1,000 Americans.[498] About 40% of personal vehicles are vans, SUVs, or light trucks.[499] The average American adult (accounting for all drivers and non-drivers) spends 55 minutes driving every day, traveling 29 miles (47Â km).[500]
